unit_learning_outcomes.description: Discuss indications for the appropriate use of imaging in chiropractic practice and critique ethical considerations related to imaging use
Implement and explain principles of radiography as applicable to chiropractic practice.
Construct narrative radiographic reports as appropriate for use in clinical chiropractic practice.
Synthesise radiographic and advanced imaging findings to aid diagnosis and inform patient management within chiropractic clinical practice.
Execute a thorough assessment of the radiographic image and differentiate and describe abnormal radiographic appearances.
Demonstrate the ability to modify radiographic technique appropriately for different clinical presentations.

non_scheduled_learning_activities.description: Revision of lecture and tutorial material

assessments.description: Radiographic Positioning Competency Based Assessments performed during tutorial time. You must be marked as competent in all competencies to pass the unit. These competencies form part of your radiographic portfolio that will be continued in clinic.
Radiographic interpretation and positioning theory exam
On-line quizzes to be performed weekly. These will be available on ilearn. Quizzes may include multiple choice and short answer questions. All quizzes should be attempted.
Radiographic Interpretation Slide Exam 1. All previous material from CHIR8401 is assumed knowledge.
Radiographic Interpretation Slide Exam 2. All previous material from CHIR8401 is assumed knowledge.

data.unit_offering_text:
Session 2, Weekday attendance, North Ryde
Session 2, Special circumstances, North Ryde
data.description: This unit builds on the principles and concepts developed in CHIR8401. It further develops radiographic interpretation with a focus on the appropriate use of imaging in clinical practice. Increasing complexity of radiographic positioning of the spine and extremities is taught, with particular reference to clinical application. This unit forms part of a suite of units in radiographic science that leads to eligibility for licensure to own and operate x-ray equipment.
data.title: Diagnostic Imaging 2
